page.title: 20PORTHMADOG PORTHMEIRION
page.content: Porthmeirion village,facing south over the Dwyryd estuary from a wooded peninsula,was developed by the architect{Sir Clough Williams Ellis. Starting in the 1920s,he built here a holiday village in whimsical Italian style,very different from the grey stone houses native to this area. Instead the buildings here are painted in gay colours_pink,blue,ochre and turquoise.In the centre of the village is an elegant stone piazza with a pool Sir Clough designed some of the buildings himself,others such as the colonnade were rescued from demolition and rebuilt here.The main hotel, converted from a 19th century house, was destroyed by fire in 1981 but is now being restored.The woods nearby are also being given attention after years of neglect.They contain many fine rhododendrons and azaleas.
